Key Match Events: France scored a 1-0 win over Belgium in the Euro 2024 last-16 match
Post-Match Reflections: Didier Deschamps’ men march on at Euro 2024
Miscellaneous Highlights: France struggled in the final third
Others: France have won all five of their meetings with Belgium at major international tournaments (Euros/World Cup)
France have reached the quarter-finals at the UEFA European Championship for a sixth time
Belgium have now failed to score in five of their last six games at major international tournaments (Euros/World Cup)
France have scored three goals at Euro 2024, with two of those being own goals (Austria’s Max Wöber and Belgium’s Jan Vertonghen) and the other coming from the penalty spot (Kylian Mbappé v Poland)
Aged 37 years and 68 days, Belgium’s Jan Vertonghen became the oldest ever player to score an own goal at the UEFA European Championship
N’Golo Kante has now played the outright most matches in European Championship history without ever ending on the losing side
